title: Charles D. McIver School
text:
The former Charles D. McIver School is a historic <a href="school">school</a> building located in <a href="Greensboro%2C%20North%20Carolina">Greensboro</a>, <a href="Guilford%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina">Guilford County, North Carolina</a>. It designed by architects <a href="Starrett%20%26amp%3B%20van%20Vleck">Starrett & van Vleck</a> in <a href="Neoclassical%20architecture">Classical Revival</a> style. It was built in 1923, and is a long, symmetrical, two-story building faced with dark, wire-cut bricks. It features a central projecting pavilion that contains the school <a href="auditorium">auditorium</a>. The building was last used as an elementary school in the 1970s. It was used as a school for special needs children until the early 2000s.It was named for <a href="Charles%20Duncan%20McIver">Charles Duncan McIver</a> (1860–1906), founder and first president of the institution now known as <a href="UNCG">The University of North Carolina at Greensboro</a>.
It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1992.
